alert.note: Alert for Essex; Franklin (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 5:50AM EST until February 18 at 8:00AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and/or snowmelt and/or ice jam continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern New York, including the following counties, Clinton, Essex and Franklin. * WHEN...Until 900 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Depending on ice behavior, any release of the ice jam could result in sudden rises of water, leading to a rapid flooding situation. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 550 AM EST, Given rainfall of 1.5 to 2.0 inches overnight, we are expecting a sharp rise on the Ausable River in the next 1 to 3 hours, where minor to moderate flood stage is anticipated. In addition, ice jam related flooding is possible through this morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lake Placid, Essex, Moriah, Willsboro, Crown Point, Westport, Wilmington, Elizabethtown, Keene, Minerva, Newcomb, Keene Valley, Mount Marcy, Jay In Essex County, Au Sable Forks, Port Henry, Schroon Lake, Crown Point Center, Keeseville and Port Kent. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
